SEARCH

Class FileOperations

java.lang.Object
FileOperations
public final class FileOperations extends Object
FileOperations class contains different methods for operating with the CSV-file. Methods in the class proceed to: - get count of lines (contacts) in the file. - storing data from the csv to a String[][]-array. - writing the String[][] array into the CSV in correct form. - printing the CSV-files data (contacts) in a easy-to-read form. - tell if CSV-file already has contacts in it.

  • Method Details

    • linesFromFile

      public static int linesFromFile()
      Method proceeds to give the count of every line (contact) in the CSV. Starting by creating BufferedReader and giving it access to the contacts.csv it reads the file line by line and adds allLines counter by one after. Proceeds this until the next line doesn't contain anything.
      Returns:
      allLines counter that displays the count of lines in a CSV.

    • csvToArray

      public static String[][] csvToArray()
      Method to store data from the CSV-file to an String[][] array. Adding all data from the CSV to a 2D-array in a correct form. Starts by creating BufferedReader and giving it access to the contacts.csv defining every row with the corresponding int-value. In a while(line != null) -loop splits all the data from given line to the String[]Â value-array by finding "," -splitter and defining 7 different data-iterations. After filling them into the allContacts[][] -array on the given row.
      Returns:
      allContacts-array, which contains all the contact-data.

    • writeArray

      public static void writeArray(String[][] input) throws IOException
      Method to write an array to a CSV-file in the correct form. Starting by creating FileWriter and giving it access to the contacts.csv proceeds to the 2D-for-loop to write every contact-data to the file. Goes through all places adding the data or "" to the file if the data is missing and "," marker after every added data except the last for dividing them from one another as in CSV. After every contacts adds "\n", for the next contact to be added.
      Parameters:
      input - array to be written to the CSV-file.
      Throws:
      IOException - throws this error, if the file cannot be found in the src folder.

    • read

      public static void read()
      Method to print the data from the CSV in an easy-to-read form. Starts by storing all the data from the file to a toPrint 2D-array by using method above and proceeds to a 2D-for-loop to go through every iteration on the array. For-loops contain switch case, which has unique print to every data-value, so that it is easy to read from the CLI.

    • ifContacts

      public static boolean ifContacts()
      Method to review if the csv-file already has contacts. Method reads the first line of a file and return true if it isn't null. If it is null (doesn't contain any files), returns false.
      Returns:
      true if the csv has contacts and false if doesn't.
